oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-06-04 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 4, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Don Gibson (host/performer), guest performers the Louvin Brothers, and regular performers Archie Campbell, the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl (who will appear on the Tennessee Ernie Ford show June 16th), and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1078th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Don Gibson; Louvin Brothers; Jordanaires; Stringbean
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Don Gibson introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Don Gibson) (recording) -- Grant Turner introduces the Louvin Brothers -- I Wish It Had Been A Dream (Louvin Brothers, Jordanaires) -- Grant Turner introduces Stringbean -- Barnyard Banjo Pickin' (Stringbean) -- Grant Turner introduces Don Gibson -- If I Can Stay Away Long Enough (Don Gibson, Jordanaires) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Don Gibson) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jordanaires (Musical group); Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003; Louvin Brothers; Louvin, Charlie, 1927-2011; Louvin, Ira, 1924-1965
